title: On Our Way to Pasar Malam

  physical_appearance: The image shows a photograph in black-and-white that is enclosed by a white frame. The background of the photograph consists of numerous high-rise flats. A couple of cars can also be discerned in the background on the roads. The foreground of the image shows a male adult and youth pushing a handcart on the road. In front of them
 there is a lady who is also pushing a handcart. Biscuit tins and kerosene lamps are on the chart of the two males. The lady has a television
 among other things
 on her cart as well.

  subject_terms_1: occupations (livelihoods) street vendors pushcarts new towns (modern settlements)

  subject_terms_2: Street photography Occupations Street-food vendors Geylang (Singapore) Handcarts New towns Black-and-white photography

  subject_terms_3: Photography Circuit Road

  sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. This photograph shows a family passing by Circuit Road as they made their way to set up a stall at a pasar malam
 the local night market. It shows how families found ways to earn a living in 1960s Singapore.

A couple of cars can also be discerned in the background on the roads. The foreground of the image shows a male adult and youth pushing a handcart on the road. In front of them, there is a lady who is also pushing a handcart. Biscuit tins and kerosene lamps are on the chart of the two males. The lady has a television, among other things, on her cart as well.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loke Hong Seng (b. 1943) was working as a radio announcer with Radio Television Singapore in the 1960s when he picked up photography and subsequently grew to specialize in street photography. His images of 1960s and 1970s Singapore offer a candid view of everyday life in the early days of the nation’s development. This photograph shows a family passing by Circuit Road as they made their way to set up a stall at a pasar malam, the local night market. It shows how families found ways to earn a living in 1960s Singapore.
